She kept the change and shut the register.  Lol!! I had been prepared to give her 18% on the purchase!!! Greedy greedy gets you niente and a poor review.
author: Judi M.

description: Wow! The mushroom ravioli was to die for.  A bit rich, had to have the waiter remove it as I couldn't stop eating it! Eat here!
author: Kelly H.

description: One of my favorite Italian restaurant is back!! Great new feel, awesome service and food.
author: P T.

description:
Fabulous dining experience! My wife and I decided to go to North Beach for dinner and started walking up Columbus Ave. We passed this place, very unassuming look compared with the nearby places. We saw people going in and saw the Yelp emblem. Did a quick check, saw the favorable reviews and decided to give it a try. Really glad we did. It was a Saturday evening and the place was crowded, but we were offered a table for two near the door and took it. We were immediately pleased by the ambiance. Lots of people, including two large parties, and everyone having a good time. Seems like there were a number of regulars who were greeted like family. By the time we left we felt like family.
What impressed us about the food was its simple, clean, "straight ahead" flavors. The Pastina in brodo had just the right chicken stock flavor. The Carpaccio di Polipo was delightful - octopus sliced razor thin, almost melt in your mouth, marinated perfectly in olive oil and lemon. I had the Spaghetti Pesto Trapenese with housemade sausage and my wife had the Linguine Pescatora in white wine sauce. Both were "Trinacria: authentic Sicilian dishes and both were amazing. The Spaghetti was flavorful itself and the pesto was strips of basil - not the heavy pesto sauce I was afraid of. The flavors were simple and subtle. The Linguine dish was an abundance of seafood perfectly cooked, with the white wine base that was not overstated. I had the cannoli for desert - again simple was best; no chocolate chips or lemon peel or candied fruit. 
The service was superb. In spite of it being a busy, crowded evening, we never felt neglected. Our waiter was attentive, gracious, knowledgeable. 
This was a great discovery! We cannot wait to return!
author: James A.

description: Had an incredible dining experience at this wonderful restaurant! The service was amazing and the staff was very welcoming. If you are looking for that Sicilian home cooked experience this is the place to go! The food is delicious and so fresh! Make sure to order wine because they have a great selection and the bartender is adorable. This family operated restaurant is wonderful and I recommend everyone go and check it out!
author: Gabby L.

description: Positively dreadful...service is non-existent and the food is overpriced nothing. Place makes the Olive Garden look good. While I was eating a deranged street person kept wandering in off the street bothering the few dinners. Reaction of the wait staff was nothing. They didn't even ask this person to leave. In fact wait staff was MIA nearly all the time. Penne pasta---they didn't even try. Frankly I am not going to waste a lot of time detailing the many faults of this dive. Suffice it to say there is a lot better in North Beach and I would not even recommend this as a fallback---starving would be a better option. Truly worthless. P.s. I find some of the glowing reviews posted here to be suspicious either that or the posters have been living in a cave for last 20 years.
author: Bill B.

description: Enjoyed a recent dinner here w/friends. Highly recommend the "Salami" di Polipo (marinated octopus) as a starter -- you won't believe how good it tastes & how appealing they make it look. The Mozzarella cheese sticks & Bruschetta were also good. Ravioli Bolognese, Ravioli Porcini, & Veal Piccata were all excellent main dishes. Extensive menu with choices for every taste (seafood, chicken, meat, pasta) with a wide selection of Italian wines (try the Rosso Piceno for a great glass of red). Nice ambiance, but service was slow & spotty through-out. It was early on a Sat night, before the big dinner crowds. Water refills came just at the end of the meals, one of the side dishes was wrong, the waiter didn't check on us once the food came, and we had to really flag him down to get our bill. The food was good, the real thing, & the place is worth checking out. Service was disappointing though & we'll probably stick to our other favorites in North Beach when we go back.
author: HJ B.

description: Food was pretty good. Service was bad. My husband ordered a special. 20 minutes later found out they now longer had any.
author: Toni Z.

description: We heard the Original US Restaurant was reopening and wanted to give it a try.  What a pleasant surprise.  The food was excellent, the menu had a wide selection, the prices were reasonable, and it had a nice family atmosphere.  We tried the calamari and mussels as appetizers.  They were some of the best mussels I have had in years.  For entrees the Chicken Parmigiana and the Seafood Pasta were excellent.  We highly recommend the Original US Restaurant, we definitely will go back.
author: John C.

description: I went to the US Restaurant the other night for the first time since it reopened. As an Italian-American from San Francisco who grew up in North Beach, I can honestly say that the food was excellent. I ate what I always ordered at the US - breaded veal cutlet. Perfect! I had a cup of pastina - also perfect. Salad excellent - fresh, delicious.  The waiter brings this nice little dish of Ceci beans and I think chopped onion - wow that was fabulous. I was going to ask for olive oil but I stuck with the Ceci. The house wine was perfect - $24 I believe, and it was nice. Now for dessert, I had this ricotta cake. I do not remember the name, but I love cannoli and this beats cannoli a for sure. Of course I will always miss the original location but my experience was wonderful and it is very nostalgic. I will be a frequent diner. It's worth it!
author: Stephen B.

description: I ordered the Halibut special on Friday. The fish was very thin, bony, tough and over cooked.  Tasted like they had thawed it in the microwave.  The sauce was fine.  I have never sent back a meal in my life, but I thought about it.  My husband ordered pasta and it was ok.  I will never to back to this restaurant.
author: Janice P.

description: Went here while visiting San Francisco and it was my favorite dinner place out of everywhere we went! I got the chicken parm and it was probably the best I've ever had. Service was wonderful. Our waiter was very sweet. Only issue was, our table was in an awkward spot so we felt like we were in everyone's way. Great wine menu as well! I have already recommended this place to my friends who will be visiting SF soon!
author: Jerilyn N.

description: This was a terrible experience. Ordered through Seamless. They forgot to give a pizza as part of a delivery of 3 items!?!  After waiting 20 minutes they said that it's their policy not to redeliver the pizza.  Sorry. So I pay the delivery service and tip but don't get my meal.  On top of it the fries were undercooked and cold and they provided no ketchup nor napkins.  Never again will I order from here and I recommend nobody does.  Customer service is not part of their vocabulary. Thanks for nothing
author: Gregg P.

description: Old school Italian restaurant, been coming here on and off (in various incarnations) for decades. Does everything it says on the tin. Great food, affable service, reasonable prices, spacious new locale. And - it's nice to give one's patronage to a remaining piece of old San Francisco. Recommended.
author: Hugh K.

description: Great new location. Beautiful ceiling and nice decor. Food as usual was wonderful. The lasagne to die for, tuna salad excellent, tiramisu perfect.  Hidden treasure in the best location. Took my family from out of town and had a nice celebration.
author: Katrena M.

description: Dinner was great. Very authentic. Antipasti was tasty. Had meatballs and the eggplant dish. All was delicious and cooked perfectly. Prices were excellent and wine pours were great. Very friendly service. Location and atmosphere was great.
author: Clark H.

description: My daughter & I had an early dinner here last week. We started with the Caprese as an appetizer. I ordered the Eggplant Parmesan and it tasted great. My daughter ordered the Risotto & was totally happy with her choice. I used to eat at their old location a lot and I think the new location is okay, but I think I prefer the old location better. The food (portion size) was also a little better at the old location. The service was excellent. I will be returning.
author: L H.

description: I went here for lunch...a simple omelet, fries and a glass of wine.  The omelet was overcooked, the fries were undercooked, flabby and greasy.  The only good thing about the meal was the dish of canellini beans.  The service was slow.  I had to constantly wave my arms to get the waiter's attention.  I'm Italian and also grew up in San Francisco.  Lunch was a huge disappointment.  I don't think I'll go back.
author: R212y3s P.

description: went last evening for eggplant parmigiana.  Started with pastena en brodo.  Waiter offered cheese and then put in so much that I had cheese soup and could nott eat it.. Egg plant was greasy and floating in sauce rather than fried and resting on sauce, so wound up not eating more than a bite.  Companions had linguini in seafood sauce, Seafood was decent but linguini was far too al dente.  Wound up taking two mains home, perhaps they would taste better next day, but they were packed in kitchen and packages leaked , so wound up with soggy mess to be thrown away.  There are far better places in North Beach
author: ira l.
